source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruiting bracteoles compressed, prominently winged, the wing enclosing the apical beak; leaves broadly rhombic or rounded
Fruiting bracteoles inflated, unwinged or narrowly winged, apical beak exposed and ± prominent; leaves narrow
Fruiting bracteoles top-shaped, with a narrow horizontal wing surrounding the apex
Fruiting bracteoles subglobose, virtually or quite unwinged
